title: Quiz 3: Health Statistics FQE (June 2022)
description: Final Qualifying Examination for Diploma in Health Records and Information Technology - June 2022

questions.question: The process where an organization plans its annual financial transaction based on statistical data on Estimates is referred to as:
questions.explanation: Budgeting involves estimating revenue and expenses over a specified future period.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a method of data collection?
questions.explanation: Sampling is a method of selecting subjects, not collecting the data itself.

questions.question: A list of items from which a researcher selects the sample from is known as:
questions.explanation: A sampling frame is the source material from which a sample is drawn.

questions.question: Why is it important to conduct sampling in a scientific study?

options.text: To leave out the unwanted items
In order to travel wide when conducting data collection

questions.explanation: Sampling reduces costs and time compared to a census.

questions.question: A researcher wants to calculate life expectancy of a population. He knows this data is available at KNBS. What data source are KNBS documents called?
questions.explanation: Data collected by another agency (KNBS) is secondary data.

questions.question: A _______ is an arrangement of data in cells.
questions.explanation: Tables organize data into rows and columns (cells).

questions.question: A _______ is a representation of data by a continuous curve on a ruled paper.
questions.explanation: Graphs (line graphs/curves) represent continuous data.

questions.question: Which of the following statements describes the purpose of Lorenz curve?

options.text: To show cumulative totals of sales in a business
To show the history of sales
To demonstrate the economic disparity in a population

questions.explanation: Lorenz curves visualize income or wealth inequality.

questions.question: In a facility with 65 beds, the ABD was 23,725 and the DD was 12,610. Calculate the Turnover Per Bed (TOB).
questions.explanation: TOB = Discharges / Beds = 12610 / 65 = 194.

questions.question: If facility X has a VBD of 12,610 and a DD of 954. Calculate the time a bed stays vacant (TOI) in days. (Round to 2 decimal places)
Calculate the mean deviation of the following figures: 5, 7, 8, 12, 18.
questions.explanation: Mean=10. Deviations: 5,3,2,2,8. Sum=20. Mean Dev = 20/5 = 4.
questions.hint: Average of absolute deviations from mean.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true about a positively skewed distribution?
questions.explanation: In positive skew, the mean is pulled to the right (largest).
questions.hint: Mean is pulled by the tail.

questions.question: What is the range of the following set of data? 60, 75, 90, 100, 130, 94, 88, 108, 70, 66
Correlation studies involves studying two variables at the same time. This type of analysis is known as?
questions.explanation: Bi-variate means two variables.

questions.question: Which of the following correctly shows ranges of correlation values?
questions.explanation: Correlation (r) ranges from -1 to +1.

questions.question: A _______ is an event which cannot be broken down into sub-events?
questions.explanation: An elementary (simple) event has only one outcome.

questions.question: The empirical rule states that:
questions.explanation: 68% within 1 SD, 95% within 2 SD, 99.7% within 3 SD.

questions.question: A _______ is an event probability which is affected by a variation of another event.
questions.explanation: Conditional probability is P(A|B).

questions.question: A set of all the sample points with their respective probability is known as?
questions.explanation: The sample space contains all possible outcomes.

questions.question: Which of the following symbols means multiplication of the probabilities?
questions.explanation: Intersection (n) corresponds to AND (Multiplication). Union (u) corresponds to OR (Addition).

questions.question: Which of the following is a source of demographic data?
questions.explanation: The Census is the primary source of demographic data.

questions.question: In country A (2017): Live births=3,829,000; Women (15-44)=58,012,000. Compute the GFR (General Fertility Rate).
Which of the following equations best indicate a proportion?
questions.explanation: Proportion is part divided by whole (a / a+b).

questions.question: A _______ is the number of newly reported cases of a given disease in a calendar year divided by the mid year population multiplied by a constant.
questions.explanation: Incidence measures new cases.

questions.question: The _______ is the number of deaths in a calendar year divided by the population at mid year multiplied by 1000
questions.explanation: Crude Death Rate (CDR).

questions.question: Country Y: Accident deaths=94,840; Total Population=243,827,000. Compute cause specific death rate per 100,000.
What is the number of deaths of infants less than 28 days that occurred in a calendar year divide by the number of live births in that year multiplied by 1000?
questions.explanation: Neonatal = < 28 days.

questions.question: What is the number of livebirths in a calendar year divided by the number of women ages 15 – 44 at mid year, multiplied by 1000?
questions.explanation: GFR targets women of childbearing age.

questions.question: Calculate the number of combinations of 5 items taking 3 at a time.
Any value that depends on chance is known as?
questions.explanation: Random variables are outcomes of chance experiments.
